dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 8431 IH: To prevent Federal agencies and contractors from using LOGINK, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Steel introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform

form.official-title: To prevent Federal agencies and contractors from using LOGINK, and for other purposes.

section.header: Prohibition on the use of LOGINK

subsection.text: A Federal agency may not use LOGINK.

paragraph.text: The head of a Federal agency may not enter into any contract with an entity that uses LOGINK and shall prohibit the use of LOGINK in any contract entered into by the agency.
This subsection applies with respect to any contract entered into on or after the date of the enactment of this section.
The term Federal agency has the meaning given the term executive agency in section 133 of title 41, United States Code.
The term LOGINK means the public, open, shared logistics information network known as the National Public Information Platform for Transportation & Logistics by the Ministry of Transport of China.
